get.summary: Get collection of files and folders in the user home directory.
get.description:
Get collection of files and folders in the user home directory.

**Known issue:** The property `isShared` is not being returned in the files collection.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies the sort by attribute. Possible values: 'fileName', 'lastModifiedTime', 'size'.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies the sort direction. Possible values: 'ASC' or 'DESC'.

parameters.name: transferMode
parameters.description: Specifies the file transfer mode: 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If present in the query string will return all metadata for the user home directory.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list; if this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered to list all rows.

parameters.name: showdots
parameters.description: Specifies whether to display or hide hidden files and folders (starting with a dot).

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.summary: Uploads file to the user home folder.
post.description:
Uploads file to the user home folder.

**Note:** This method can also update the user home folder metadata if body parameter is specified and the content-type is 'application/json' or 'application/xml'.

parameters.name: transferMode
parameters.description: Specifies the file transfer mode: 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.description: Get list of files, if the specified file is directory. Otherwise get the file content. If the file path contains GLOB characters a listing will be performed. If status parameter is present will return the file metadata.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Specifies the target file path.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Specifies the sort by attribute. Possible values: 'fileName', 'lastModifiedTime', 'size'.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies the sort direction. Possible values: 'ASC' or 'DESC'.

parameters.name: transferMode
parameters.description: Specifies the file transfer mode: 'ASCII' or 'BINARY'.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If present in the query string will return all metadata for the user home directory.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The start row to list; if this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit of the listed rows; if this parameter is not set, then it is considered to list all rows.

parameters.name: showdots
parameters.description: Specifies whether to display or hide hidden files and folders (starting with a dot).

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.description:
Updates metadata of the file, pointed by the filepath. If the file name stored in the File object is different then the one in the filepath will rename the target file/directory.

**Note:** This method can also upload file to the folder, pointed by the filepath, if the query parameter 'transferMode' is specified and the content-type is 'multipart/form-data'.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Specifies the file path.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new file metadata to create.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

put.description:
Creates a file or directory with specified filepath.

**Note:** This method can also upload any file, if the query parameter 'transferMode' is specified.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Specifies the full file path, including file name.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file metadata to create.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

delete.description: Deletes the file or directory, specified by the file path argument.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Specifies the target file path to delete.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.description: Get general information about email folders. System folders can be referenced as _inbox, _sent and _drafts, but the REST API exposes them as _("Inbox"), _("Sent") and _("Drafts") as well, or their translations depending on the value of the "Accept-Language" header.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - the requested package is not found.

get.summary: Get messages in an email folder.

parameters.description: The name of the folder.

parameters.description: Starting index for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. The limit parameter can has only non negative integer value. If the value is 0, only the number of items in the folder is retrieved.

404.description: Not Found - the requested package is not found.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The limit is not positive number.

Rename folder.

parameters.description: The name of the folder that should be changed.

parameters.description: The new name of the folder.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - the requested package is not found.

get.summary: Retrieve the download history of a given message.
get.description: Retrieve the download history of a given message.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message which history to retrieve. The ID is Base64 encoded.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size for pagination (the limit of the listed rows). The limit parameter can has only a positive integer value. If limit is not set then the full download history will be retrieved.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting index for pagination (the start row to list). The offset parameter can has only a positive integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

500.description: Internal Server Error - for example if  limit is not a positive number.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting index for pagination (the start row to list). The offset parameter can has only a positive integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

question

get.summary: Get message content (body) in text/plain or text/html format.
get.description: Get message content (body). Message body can be get in two MIME types: text/plain and text/html  these are denoted by Request header Accept. Message body is identified by streamId  that path parameter can be obtained from response when getting /mailbox/messages/{messageId}.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message which content (body) to retrieve. The ID is Base64 encoded.

parameters.name: streamId
parameters.description: The stream ID of the message content.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

get.summary: Get message body in text/html format.
get.description: This resource deals with Message body. Message body is identified by streamId  that path parameter can be obtained from response when getting /mailbox/messages/{messageId}. The path parameter unsanitized is a marker and it denotes to get message body in text/html format but its content will be escaped (any <, >,  and other HTML specific characters will be escaped).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message which content (body) to retrieve. The ID is Base64 encoded.

parameters.name: streamId
parameters.description: The stream ID of the message content.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

post.summary: Create a draft that has the same attachments as a specified message.
post.description: Create a draft that has the same attachments as the message with the given {messageId}. The draft resides in the "Drafts" system folder (only for registered users).

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message which custom properties to set. The ID is Base64 encoded.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of recipients.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of carbon-copy recipients.

parameters.name: bcc
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of blind carbon-copy recipients.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The message's subject

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message's content

parameters.name: security
question
parameters.description: The message's secret question (ignored if security level is not challenge)

parameters.name: answer
parameters.description: the answer to the message's secret question (ignored if security level is not challenge)

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: The expiration interval in minutes for this message. If null default expiration will be set.

204.description: Successful operation. The response message contain info message "Draft was successfully created" and the "messageId" property of the newly created draft.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

put.summary: Recall a message that was sent by the current user (Not Implemented).

Recall a message that was sent by the current user. 

`Note`: **The recall of a message is not implemented**.

parameters.description: The ID of the message to recall.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.summary: Create a draft as a reply to a given message.
post.description:
Create a draft as a reply to a given message. The draft resides in the "Drafts" system folder (only for registered users).

**Known issue:** This request creates new message draft, instead to create draft message reply for a received message.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message to reply.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of recipients.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of carbon-copy recipients.

parameters.name: bcc
parameters.description: Comma-separated email addresses of blind carbon-copy recipients.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The message's subject

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message's content

parameters.name: security
question
parameters.description: The message's secret question (ignored if security level is not challenge)

parameters.name: answer
parameters.description: the answer to the message's secret question (ignored if security level is not challenge)

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: The expiration interval in minutes for this message. If null default expiration will be set.

200.description: Successfully created draft. The response contains the messageId of the newly created draft.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

put.summary: Send a draft with a given messageId.
put.description:
Send a draft with a given messageId.

`Note`: At least one of to, cc, and bcc must be non-empty in the draft that is about to be sent.

**Known issue:** If the given messageId is an ID of already submitted message, the result is "Successfully sent draft and ID of the sent message." instead of error message. In the ST log will be saved an error message describing the error.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the draft to send. The ID is Base64 encoded.

204.description: Successfully sent draft. The response contains the messageId of the sent message (it is the same as the ID of the draft).

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if requested message is not available.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

parameters.description: The message hex ID.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.summary: Search the mailbox for a given message.
get.description:
Search the mailbox for a given message. The search includes all messages - sent, received, and drafts.

**Known issue:** This method does not search successfully all the messages.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. The limit parameter can has only positive integer value.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: starting index for pagination

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: A substring to search for in the message subject.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the message to search for. Valid options for a transfer status are: `In Progress`, `Processed`, `Failed`, `Aborted`, `Pending receipt`, `Failed Subtransmission`, `Paused` and `Failed Transfer Resubmit`.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: The exact name of the folder.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: A substring that is contained in the email address of the sender

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: A substring that is contained in the email address of any of the recipients.

parameters.name: sentDateBefore
parameters.description: The date before which the message was sent (the date is included in the range) in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: sentDateAfter
parameters.description: The date after which the message was sent (the date is included in the range) in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: expireDateBefore
parameters.description: The date after which the message will expire (the date is included in the range) in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: expireDateAfter
parameters.description: The date before which the message will expire (the date is included in the range) in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

200.description: Successful operation but no messages matching the criteria are always found.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.summary: Get the account of the currently logged user.
get.description: Get the account of the currently logged user.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

404.description: Not Found - for example if the user does not have an account.

post.description: Login user. Here a user can receive a cookie to use for successive web service calls.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

delete.summary: Log out the currently logged-in user from REST API.
delete.description: Log out the currently logged-in user from REST API.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.summary: Change the password of the currently logged user.
post.description: Change the password of the currently logged user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A changePassword entity containing the old password and the new password to set of the currently logged user.

204.description: Successfully changed password of the currently logged user.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: if the oldPassword property is not correct.

get.description: Get the password expired message.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: if the oldPassword property is not correct.

get.description: Get the server UTC time. The date format is `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'` and conforms to ISO-8601 date formatting standard

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: if the oldPassword property is not correct.

get.summary: Send email with the new password.
get.description: Send email with the new password.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The security token to validate that this is a proper reset password request.

200.description: A password reset email is sent the requested email.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: if the oldPassword property is not correct.

post.summary: Send password reset email with a security token to the requested email.
post.description: Send password reset email with a security token to the requested email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A resetPassword entity containing the wanted email to send password reset email to.

204.description: Successfully sent password reset email to the requested email.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request. Example: if the oldPassword property is not correct.

get.summary: Get sharing metadata for the home folder of the current user.
get.description: Get sharing metadata for the home folder of the current user. If `metadata` parameter is provided, gets the metadata for the home folder.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Defines whether to return current user home folder metadata or current user home folder descendants metadata. Set `false` to get shared folders in the home folder of the current user. Set `true` to get metadata for the current user home folder.

200.description: Successful operation. When `metadata` query parameter is not set or has value `false` then sharedFolders collection of sharedFolder entities is returned. When `metadata` query parameter has value `true` a sharedFolder entity is returned.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.summary: Get sharing metadata for the first level descendants of the folder specified.
get.description: Get sharing metadata for the first level descendants of the folder specified. If `metadata` parameter is provided, gets the metadata for the requested folder.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: A relative folder path.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Defines whether to return current folder metadata or its first level descendants metadata. Set `false` to get sub-level shared folders. Set `true` to get metadata only for the folder specified in path.

200.description: Successful operation. When `metadata` query parameter is not set or has value `false` then sharedFolders collection of sharedFolder entities is returned. When `metadata` query parameter has value `true` a sharedFolder entity is returned.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

put.description:
Share folder with other users. 

Notes: 
  - There is a global server configuration option **SharedFolders.AllowCollaboration** that defines whether the folder collaboration is enabled or not. 
  - If the global server configuration option **SharedFolders.AllowCollaboration** has value `false` or the owner of the folder do not belong to a business unit then the specified folder can not be shared with other users.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: A relative folder path.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Folder sharing options metadata.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: A relative folder path.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.description: Retrieve transfer log entries matching the search criteria.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve. The limit parameter can has only positive integer value.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from the first returned result. The offset parameter can has only nonnegative integer value. If this parameter is not set, then it is considered 0.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The transfered file.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: The transfer site name.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A list of transfer statuses. Valid options for a transfer status are: `In Progress`, `Processed`, `Failed`, `Aborted`, `Pending receipt`, `Failed Subtransmission`, `Paused` and `Failed Transfer Resubmit`.

parameters.name: startTimeBefore
parameters.description: The time before which the transfer started in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: endTimeBefore
parameters.description: The time before which the transfer ended in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: startTimeAfter
parameters.description: The time after which the transfer started in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: endTimeAfter
parameters.description: The time after which the transfer ended in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z).

parameters.name: actionBy
parameters.description: Transfer initiated by Server or Client. Possible values are: `User` or `Server`.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: A list of transfer protocols. Valid options for a transfer protocol are: `as2`, `ftp`, `http`, `ssh`, `pesit`, `folder` and `adhoc`.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: A list of application names. More than one parameter is allowed.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The transfer direction. Possible values are: `Incoming` or `Outgoing`.

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: Define the transfer type - secure or non-secure transfer. Possible values are: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: operationIndex
parameters.description: A list of operation indexes.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

parameters.name: folderMonitorEntity
parameters.description: The folder monitor request entity.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.description: Pull files from a given site.

parameters.name: serverPull
parameters.description: The server pull entity.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

post.summary: Push a file to a given site.
post.description: Push a file to a given site.

parameters.name: serverPush
parameters.description: The server pull entity.

400.description: Bad request - the returned error message will tell what was incorrect in the request.

get.description: Get a specific transfer log entry.

parameters.description: The Base64 encoded ID of the transfer entity to get.

filePath.description: The file path over which this operation will be executed

errorMsg.description: Specifies the error message if the operation has failed.

isDirectory.description: Specifies whether the file is directory or not

isRegularFile.description: Specifies whether the file is regular file or not

isSymbolicLink.description: Specifies whether the file is symbolic link or not

isOther.description: Specifies whether the file type is other or not

isShared.description: Specifies whether the folder is shared or not (only present for folders).

address.description: The recipient IP address. This property is set when the delivery method is `Anonymous`

anonymous.description: Define whether this recipient is anonymous (true if account is anonymous, false otherwise)

protocol.description: The protocol. Value of "http" is  hard coded.

address.description: The recipient address (the internet address user is connecting from). This property is set when the delivery method is `Anonymous`

anonymous.description: Define whether this recipient is anonymous (true if account is anonymous, false otherwise)

protocol.description: The protocol. Value of "http" is  hard coded.

firstAccessTimestamp.description: The time stamp when package was access for first time by this recipient.

name.description: The name of the custom property

value.description: The value of the custom property.

homeFolder.description: The home folder on the local system used for this account. The folder path name must be a valid absolute directory name

uid.description: The numeric user ID of the account

gid.description: The numeric group ID of the account

disabled.description: This property defines if this account is disabled. If the account is disabled: 1) Subscriptions for the account will not trigger. ; 2) Users associated with the account will not be able to login and perform any transfers

enum: Axway Box and Stripe in Blue

notes.description: An unstructured comments to the account

type.description: The account type. Type 'user' means user account; type 'service' means service account; type 'template' means account template

unlicensed.description: This property defines if the account is an unlicensed account

authByEmail.description: This property defines if authentication by email address is allowed for this account

businessUnit.description: The business unit that account belongs to

contact.description: The address book contact which is associated tith an account entity. Reffer to the 'AccountContact' definition

deliveryMethod.description: This property defines the delivery method. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Disabled' then Adhoc is disabled and enrollmentType/implicitEnrollmentType can not be set. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Default' then it is only available on BU and Account (setting the BU to use the value and account to use the BU value). When deliveryMethod is set to 'Anonymous' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous' and "" (empty string for Select by sender) are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account Without Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', ""  (empty string for Select by sender) and 'Existing Account' are enabled. When deliveryMethod is set to 'Account With Enrollment' then implicit enrollment types 'Anonymous', "" (empty string for Select by sender), 'Enroll unlicensed', 'Enroll licensed' are enabled

enrollmentTypes.description: This property is used for a custom delivery method and can be set only if deliveryMethod property is set to 'Custom'

implicitEnrollmentType.description: The Implicit Enrollment Type value controls which option Web Access Plus selects initially in the User Access window and which enrollment type is used by the Axway Email Plug-ins. The choices depend on the enrollment types enabled by the Delivery Methods and Enrollment Types fields

isUnlicensedUserAllowedToReply.description: This property defines if the unlicensed user may reply to packages

wapAppletEnabled.description: This property defines if Java WAP applet enabled or not for this account.

requestArrivalTime.description: The server time when request is received. The date format is `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'` and conforms to ISO-8601 date formatting standard

responseDepartureTime.description: The server time when response is sent. The date format is `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'` and conforms to ISO-8601 date formatting standard.

isShared.description: Define whether the folder is shared with other users (true if shared, false otherwise)

isOwner.description: Define whether the currently logged-in user is the folder owner (true if the user is the owner, otherwise false)

shareRights.description: The the shared rights. Permissions: value **1** for `Download files`, value **3** for `Download and Upload files`, value **7** for `Download, Upload and Overwrite files`."

enableNotifications.description: Define whether the notifications are enabled (true if notifications are enabled, otherwise - false)

enableOwnerNotifications.description: Define whether the notifications are enabled for the folder owner(true if owner notifications are enabled, otherwise - false)

showCollaboratorsToAll.description: Define whether the showing collaborators is enabled to all (true if enabled, false otherwise)

collaborators.description: A set of collaborators' email addresses.

users.description: List of email addresses that the folder is shared with

ownerNotifications.description: Enable or disable notifications for folder owner

showCollaboratorsToAll.description: Define whether showing all collaborators is enabled or not.

secure.description: Defines whether the transfer occurred over secure connection

account.description: The name of the account that performed the transfer

login.description: The user login name used for this transfer

actionBy.description: Defines whether the transfer is server or client initiated

filename.description: The name of the transferred file

protocol.description: The protocol used to transfer the file

startTime.description: The time when transfer started in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z)

duration.description: Defines the time when transfer is finished (in miliseconds)

operationIndex.description: The operation index of the transfer. It could be '(none)' or some ID.

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started in RFC2822 format (EEE, d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss Z)

account.description: The name of the account that performed the transfer

login.description: The user login name used for this transfer

userClass.description: The user class. By default the user class can be `VirtClass` or `RealClass`

size.description: The size of the transferred file

sessionId.description: The session ID of the transfer

archivedAs.description: The name under which the transferred file is archived

subtransmissionStatuses.description: Status of the subtransmission operations (if there are any)

requestEntity.description: Representation of the rest api call that initiated the transfer(if submitted through the ST RESTful API).

result.description: The result of the operation (usually a filename)

operationIndex.description: The transfer's operation index denoting a group file transfer inspired by this monitored folder

downloadFolder.description: The download folder from which files are retrieved

fileCaseSensitive.description: Define whether the file pattern is to take into account case-sensitiveness (true if case-sensitive, false otherwise)

subFolderCaseSensitive.description: Define whether the sub-folder pattern is to take into account case-sensitiveness

maxDepth.description: The sub-folder traverse maximum depth. If this property is negative then the whole sub-folder tree will be traversed

uploadFolder.description: The upload folder where files are moved.

asynchronousCall.description: Define whether the transfer is to be executed asynchronously (true if transfer is to be executed asynchronously, false otherwise)

transferProfile.description: The transfer profile name. Note: **This attribute is required in PeSIT protocol transfers only**.

asynchronousCall.description: Define whether the transfer is to be executed asynchronously (true if transfer is to be executed asynchronously, false otherwise)

transferProfile.description: The transfer profile name. Note: **This attribute is required in PeSIT protocol transfers only**.

receipt.description: Defines whether the data is a receipt (true if the data is receipt, false otherwise)

startTime.description: The time when the transfer started

AsyncOperation_result.description: Specifies the md5 checksum and the file size result of the operation.

AsyncOperation_customAttributes.description: Specifies the transfer mode of the operation. It can be 'BINARY' or 'ASCII'.
